content.raw:
On a related note, the lighting problem is partially caused by a long existing model / gazebo problem, see Gazebo [issue 256](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/256/dae-file-rendering-problem) and [266](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/266/dae-and-stl-lighting).

The normals seem to be interpreted as if they would all go along the (negative?) x-axis which causes the polaris to be dark in its default orientation and much much more lit when rotating it by 180 degrees (see video in comments in issue 256).

This bug becomes kinda funny when you drive the vehicle with moving wheels as they turn into little disco balls that switch between bright and dark every half rotation.
